name: CQUESTwithBruker-preproc
author: Hélène RATINEY / Denis Grenier / Théotime Ferh--Delude
description: Proprocessing pipeline for spectroscopy signals acquired on a Brucker MRI followed by cQuest MR spectrosocpy signal quantification software.
command-line: mkdir out; unzip [MYZIP]; metaboliteFile=$(grep -m 1 '^met=' [PARAM_FILE] | cut -d ' ' -f1 | cut -d '=' -f2); python3 /bruker-spectro-processing-pipeline/vip_prepro.py [FIDFILE] [ACQPFILE] [METHODFILE] [REFSCANFILE] [RAWJOB0FILE] [PPM_R] [PPM_A] [NOISE_R] [DISPLAY_R] [MEAN_LW] [STDEV_LW] [STDEV_FR] [MV_AV] --metabolite $metaboliteFile --outname [OUTNAME] --outpath ./; echo "Preprocessing finished, listing files and launching cQuest"; ls ; /cquest_exec/cquestCml -f [PARAM_FILE] [BRUKER_MRUI]; /cquest_exec/cquestCml -f [PARAM_FILE] [PASTIS_MRUI]

inputs.name: Parameter text file for cQuest
inputs.description: File setting up constraints, options and prior knowledge used in cQuest algorithm

inputs.name: Zipped data base folder for cQuest
inputs.description: Archive containing the files listed in the parameter file

inputs.name: ppm_r
inputs.description: MUST be an interval in the format start_end   . frequency region in ppm on which phasing operations are focused.

inputs.name: ppm_a
inputs.description: MUST be an interval in the format start_end   . frequency region in ppm on which SNR and LW analysis are performed (NAA peak).

inputs.name: noise_r
inputs.description: MUST be an interval in the format start_end   . frequency region in ppm on which noise level is estimated

inputs.name: display_r
inputs.description: MUST be an interval in the format start_end   . frequency region in ppm used to display the spectra

inputs.name: mean_lw_Hz
inputs.description: Mean linewidth considered as good linewidth for further analysis (Hz)

inputs.name: stdev_lw_Hz
inputs.description: acceptable standard deviation around the mean linewidth (Hz)

inputs.name: stdev_fr_ppm
inputs.description: acceptable standard deviation/amplitude of the frequency fluctuation/drift in ppm

inputs.name: mv_av
inputs.description: number of spectra in a moving average used in the analyze and reject procedure
